text: :For the Corbett of the same name in Glen Dessary see Càrn Mòr. Càrn Mòr (804 m) is the highest mountain of the Ladder Hills on the border of Aberdeenshire and Moray, Scotland. It is located northeast of the Cairngorm Mountains near Strathdon. It rises high above Glenlivet in an area once renowned for its whiskey smuggling. == References == Category:Mountains and hills of Aberdeenshire Category:Mountains and hills of Moray Category:Marilyns of Scotland Category:Corbetts
title: Càrn Mòr (Ladder Hills)
